mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Bushrod Washington to Hannah Bushrod Washington, 1783 July 1
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Bushrod, 1762-1829
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Bushod Washington writes to his mother expressing his Indebtedness to her for her faithful correspondence ... hopes to shorten stay in Philadelphia, by devoting all his time to law. ... reflects on his first 21 yrs ... is sending his portrait, painted by Henry Benbridge (MVLA A-1263, H-2620). Expresses his opinion of the picture. Concern about his sister Milly, discusses education of women in general & especially his sister's. Desires her to learn music & French if any tutors can still be found in Virginia. If not, will tutor her himself when he returns. Believes a woman should learn more than just domestic duties. Will write sister (Jane) an account of Mrs. (?) a very good friend who is the victim of persecuting misfortune, "the most Unhappy woman in the world". Autograph letter signed, 8 pages, silked.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington, Hannah Bushrod, approximately 1738-1804
